intro: Arctotis stoechadifolia var. grandis, commonly known as the grandiflora arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant typically blooms from late winter to early spring, making it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in coastal environments.
